Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content:
what are you thoughts on this 
miketout Yesterday at 5:18 PM
at first, we will be able to support Verus as the reserve currency. Eventually, I want to see it go hierarchical in Verus (reserve currencies launching reserves in their ecosystem) and to support external blockchains as well, which would mean Komodo's would be first, since they are our extended ecosystem and closest daemon to us. It will require non-trivial work to be able to do the same for Komodo currencies, but I believe that is possible sooner than any other blockchain system besides Verus. Most of the core concepts are there and the reserve system uses enhaned CCs, which would need to be ported,. The other thing is that all the pieces kind of fit together, and make the whole better with each part. For example, 50% PoS stake and non-equihash proof of power fits right into the model with merge mining support and staking of currency reserves being used to automatically purchase currencies and replenish notarization rewards without external payment. The new merge mining support and PoS security will require either VerusHash 2.0 or similar, or a double-sized block header, since the equihash space is re-purposed. It would be easiest if Komodo also had support for VerusHash 2.0, VerusPoP, but another approach could be just porting the enhanced CCs, adding the consensus changes, then integrating the merkle mountain range to improve/simplify Komodo's notarization and leverage Komodo notarization to create a reserve connector. Basically, there would be a fair bit of work and some consensus rule changes, but it can be done.

Author: Art.F#5377
Content: @jl777c here is some more info about the project :i would like to build on Komodo.I really think it can be of value for Komodo as it will show that projects can be build in a better way than,lets say eth. For my project i need a governance  platform.In order to govern members have to integrate their smart contract into the platform.The DAO will act in the physical world .The coin is the asset or represents a part of an asset in the physical world.Tangibles like land,water,food,rare earth minerals a.s.o.The smart contract should be the certificate of ownership the coin the representation of the asset.Through the platform the DAO members make proposals and vote on using the ownership mass to create wealth.Benefits from using the ownership mass in the physical world would be paid out 100% to the participants .The platform should include also a DEX where members can swap their benefits ,if they want to ,into other cryptocurrencies. The platform should also include the possibility of staking the coins at a yearly rate.Also it has to be able to offer lending at best rates for the members.To include some fun members should be able to play games.Komodo's documentation shows that all this can be done on a Komodo asset chain.We already have assets in place but in order to implement a first proposal we have to partially crowd fund.I would like to use the Komodo white label crowdfunding  dApp for this purpose.To be able to implement this we need the participation of dev's knowing their way around the Komodo Blockchain.For benefits of course.

Author: Crabby Paddy#6239
Content: @jl777c can you explain the implications this new solution offers? Both for kmd and for other coins? For a non tech person ğŸ˜›

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: SPV wallets allow lite wallets to only download header data (and a little bit more per utxo)

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Lite clients are lighter now ğŸ˜›

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but for a blockchain with a million blocks, that is a million headers (2GB)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which isnt so lite... non-equihash coins have 80 byte headers so the problem is really bad for equihash coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that means for a normal SPV wallet, you would need to sync 2GB+ of headers before you can validate the utxo, and each utxo needs merkleproofs on top

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with nSPV, on average each utxo needs 20kb of headers and the usual merkleproofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so a wallet with 10 utxo would need 200kb vs 2GB of headers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 10000x difference in bandwidth and it is so small, it doesnt even need to be stored locally

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, the issue of attacks is dramatically mitigated as only a single honest node is needed and all dishonest nodes are immediately found out as the notarizations cant be forged

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is called superlight clients

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it will basically achieve the same performance level of electrum servers, without any servers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it solves the scalability issue quite completely

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not a bad result for struggling with the flyclient paper

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
@jl777c How can this nSPV be made available on mobile clients? Right now there are 2 types of mobile lite clients:
- Electrum SPV based, which uses a user specified Electrum Servers
- Native SPV clients, like Mycelium or BreadWallet or Bitcoin Core wallets which directly connects to the p2p network of blockchain, as I understand,

So, what would be the way for making these nSPV clients available on mobiles? What kind of development needs there are in implementation?
